titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Himalayan Collection Pamphlets and Reports
titlestmt.author: Martha Hershey Brundage

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday March 26, 2019 at 22:12

did.abstract: This record group includes pamphlets, reports, and ephemera that were part of the library of the Himalayan Archives Association, a group was formed to coordinate care for the archives of four organizations that had been deposited at the University of Edinburgh in the early 1990s.The Himalayan Mission Archive Collection at the Yale Divinity School Library was formed in 2008 when the archives of the four organizations and their umbrella association were transferred to Yale from the Centre for the Study of World Christianity at the University of Edinburgh.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of the Himalayan Archives Association, 2008.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Himalayan Collection Pamphlets and Reports (RG 211), Special Collections, Yale Divinity School Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Himalayan Archives Association was formed to coordinate care for the archives of four organizations that had been deposited at the University of Edinburgh in the early 1990s. In 2007 when space constraints required the removal of the archives from the University of Edinburgh, the Yale Divinity School Library offered to provide a home for them and the records were received by Yale in 2008.

In addition to the archives of the United Mission to Nepal, International Nepal Fellowship, Central Asia Fellowship, and Nepal Church History Project, the materials received by Yale in 2008 also included the general library of the Himalayan Archives Association. Books in this Himalayan Archives Association have been classified with a local call number system beginning with HC000001. The collection of more than 180 published works can be browsed online via the Orbis "Local call number" search option. The materials in this records group are smaller pamphlets, booklets, reports, and ephemera, which have been described archivally rather than individually cataloged.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The pamphlets and reports in this collection relate to Christianity and other issues in the Himalayan region. The topics of the classification categories give a good overview of the types of material included. These are primarily printed materials related to two of the four organizations for which the Himalayan Archives Assocation was an umbrella agency, The United Mission to Nepal, International Nepal Fellowship, as well as topics such as history and politics, culture, government, and development in the Himalayan region, including Nepal, Bhutan, Tibet, and Mongolia.

For related material, see the finding aids for Record Groups 212, 213, 214, and 215, which are the archives of the United Mission to Nepal, International Nepal Fellowship, Central Asia Fellowship, and Nepal Church History Project.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The letter classifications utilized in this series were applied to organize pamphlet materials in the Himalayan Collection when it was held at the University of Edinburgh.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Nepal Evangelistic Band and pre-1900 materials.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: More assorted newspaper articles and articles printed from the internet about Nepal. Some pertain to politics, but this folder also has some related to environmental and cultural topics. Some of the articles include: The Kathmandu Valley: Earthquake Risk Management Action Plan (1999); Analyzation of Nepali Music by M. Thoresen Tansen

did.unittitle: Articles Regarding Religion and Human Ecology

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Titles: References to Buddhism in the Nepalamahatmya by Horst Brinkhaus (1980); Regional Circles and the Central Overseer of the Vaishnavite Sects in the Kingdom of Nepal by Richard Burghart (1984); Ascetics in Western Nepal by Patricia Caplan (1973); The Divali, the Lamp Festival of the Hindus by W. Crooke (1923); The Lepcha People and Their Notions of Heaven and Hell by Kali Kumar Das (1896); Harmonizing Dimension in Hindu Civilizational Processes by S. C. Dube (1983); Introduction: Human Ecology in the Himalaya by Thomas Fricke (1989); Nepal (Kingdom of Nepal) ed. by Robin Morgan (1984); The Limbu or Kiranti People of Eastern Nepal and Sikkim by Kali Kumar Das (1896); Recent Works on Shamanism, A Review ARticle by Mircea Eliade (n.d.); Miscellanea Divali-Folklore by B. A. Gupte (1903); A Nepalese Shamanism and the Classic Inner Asian Tradition by John T. Hitchcock (1967); Preliminary Report on a Field Research in a Western Tamang Group, Nepal by Andras Hoefer (1969); Religious Belief and Development: A Christian Approach to Development Among Animistic/Shamanistic Peoples (with special reference to North Western Nepal (Jumla)) by John Studley (1992); Ecological Change and Adaptation Among the Gurungs by Donald A. Messerschmidt (1976)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This folder contains assorted materials regarding religion in Nepal, with a particular focus on Christianity. The contents are primarily newspaper articles and articles printed from the internet, but it also includes handwritten notes and a few slim booklets. Some of the materials are in Nepalese, but most are in English. Titles include, but are not limited to... The Festivals of Nepal by Nepal's Ministry of Tourism; U.K. Christian Centre for Buddhist Studies pamphlet; Hinduism: The Religion of India by The Quiet Miracle magazine (1986); Traditional Health Beliefs and Healing Practices in Nepal;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These materials primarily relate to India. Titles: On International Migration and International Relations by Myron Weiner (1985); Immigration: The Foreign Trickle by Davis (1951); Assorted copied pages from The population of India and Pakistan by Davis (1951); Assorted handwritten pages Indian Census Centenary Seminar: Summaries of Papers & Proceedings in Delhi - Internal Migration Moderator's Statement by Sidney Goldstein (1972)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This folder contains materials regarding Nepalese society. In particular, articles relate to ethinic and tribal groups, languages of these groups, and Nepalese women in their society. The materials are all copied articles and handwritten notes. Titles include but are not limited to... Working in a Multi Religious and Multi Cultural Society by Rita Rudra; Legal Position of Nepalese Women in Family by Silu Singh; Nepalese Women by Indra Majupuria (1982); Lepcha Marriage Customs (1934); Prayer for Nepal (1985); Ethnographic Notes on the Tamangs of Nepal by Christoph von Furer-Haimendorf (1956); Preliminary Report on a Field Research in a Western Tamang Group, Nepal by Andras Hofer; Notes on the Language of Gurung Pe by S. S. Strickland (1987); Status and Interaction among the High Hindu Castes of Nepal by Christoph von Furer-Haimendorf (1971)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Titles: Sanskritization in Eastern Nepal by Rex L. Jones (1976); Hinduization of a Himalayan Tribe in Nepal by Shigeru Iijima (1963); Ritual Brotherhood: A Cohesive Factor in Nepalese Society by Ferdinand E. Okada (1957); Cultural Politics: Religious Activism and Ideological Transformation Among 20th Century Sherpas by Sherry B. Ortner (1989); Ethnographic Notes on the Tamangs of Nepal by Christoph von Fuerer-Haimendorf (1956); Dasain and Tihar: The Two Great Festivals of Nepalese by Deepkar Rajbhandari (1991)

did.unittitle: S: Government and State of Nepal

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Pamphlets entitled "Nepal in Figures" from 1988, 1992, 1994, and 1996, printed by the Central Bureau of Statistics of Nepal.

scopecontent.p: Census of Population: Nepal 1952-1954 A.D. by the Department of Statistics in Kathmandu, Nepal (1958)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Three books written in Nepalese.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This folder contains 5 books entitled "Statistical Pocket Book: Nepal" published by the Central Bureau of Statistics in Nepal in the years 1974, 1982, 1988, 1990, and 1994.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This folder contains three publications of the Constitutuion of Nepal. Titles: The Constitution of the Kingdom of Nepal by Nepal Trading Corporation (1959); The Constitution of Nepal (as amended on January 27, 1967 by the First Amendment of the Constitution) by His Majesty's Government of Nepal Ministry of Law and Justice (1967); Constitution of the Kingdom of Nepal 2047 and Electoral Laws by Legal Research ASsociates (1990)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Titles: His Majesty's Government Three Year Plan 1962-65 Summary (1962); Nepal The Fifth Plan (1975-80) In Brief by the National Planning Commission His Majesty's Government Nepal (1975); Basic Principles of The Seventh Plan (1985-1990) by His Majesty's Government National Planning Commission Kathmandu (March, 1984); Approach to The Eighth Plan 1992-97 by His Majesty's Government National Planning Commission Nepal (November, 1991)
